email.title: Weekly Digest

image.title: I am tired and feeling unoriginal in terms of biscuits

email.text:
What a weekend has it been at IC Hack 20 these last 48 hours! The biggest IC Hack ever, all thanks to our wonderful sponsors. We hope all of you who participated had just as much fun as we had organizing it.
Next week will be relatively quiet, as we take a well-deserved break to recover and to be back track for more amazing events. Also, February has only begun and we have two more hackathons in collab. On top for that we are excited to announce this year's edition of our traditional black tie event - Revel!\ More information coming below, so read on!
email.heading: DoCSoc Education: Intermediate Python

event.text:
For those of you who have dabbled a little bit in programming before (Python or not) and want to learn more, DoCSoc is holding a free, 5-week course on intermediate Python!
We expect you to know the basics of programming already - functions, conditionals, loops, basic data structures and types, etc, either from Python or other languages.
We will cover a range of topics, such as object-oriented programming, good software engineering design, as well as applications of Python in statistics, sciences, machine learning/data science, and building web applications.
The course will focus on enabling you to understand the underlying logic and thinking process of programming, in order for you to become self-sufficient in your own learning and future development.
This event will be catered, but make sure to grab a ticket on Eventbrite to secure a couple of slices for yourself!
Don't worry if you can't come to a few sessions, we will be posting all the material on the event page!

email.heading: DoCSoc Education: Python for Beginners

event.text:
Want to know how to code but have no idea where to start? Tried to learn on your own but not really made any progress?
Whether you've dabbled in programming before, or you barely know what a computer is, DoCSoc (Department of Computing Society) is once again running a course for you!
After our highly successful (and award-winning!) series last year, we'll be repeating our beginners coding course starting Thursday, 30th January.
This year the course is open to everyone! Just make sure to grab a ticket on Eventbrite to ensure you have pizza at the event! Let us know about any dietary requirements by emailing us at docsoc@ic.ac.uk.
If you think you're not a beginner, you might be interested in our intermediate course: https://www.facebook.com/events/471162783560184/. This course is for people who have an understanding of basic programming concepts (either from Python, or other languages i.e. R, Matlab, etc), and will focus more on actual real-world usages of Python. If you're not sure if you fit into this category, feel free to PM us!
Don't worry if you can't come to a few sessions, we will be posting all the material on the event page!
Any questions at all please leave them below, and we hope to see you at the first lecture on Thursday, in Huxley 144.
[**We'd also appreciate if you filled out this form.**](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLScwCB8knQrcKfNZs7jkIRahL5muCifxJ_7Eu2CA9QxAo7HYHQ/viewform)

email.heading: Raspberry Pi Workshops

event.text:
Have you ever wanted to know more about a Raspberry Pi? Or are you a first year Computing student whose summer project will closely involve the Raspberry Pi? Then come join us at our new 4-week Raspberry Pi course where you will get to learn what this small computer is capable of!
We will introduce the Pi, its architecture and do multiple demos for VNC Connections, Python + Assembly programming and coding a tiny bootloader!
These workshops are open to everyone! Make sure to grab your Eventbrite ticket to get free pizza!

email.heading: Google Hashcode Imperial College London Hub

event.text:
Hash Code is a team programming competition, organized by Google, for students and professionals around the world. You pick your team and programming language and we pick an engineering problem for you to solve. Join us at the Imperial College London Hub for the Online Qualification Round. Top teams will then be invited to a Google office for the Final Round.
Sign up here: https://g.co/hashcode Remember to select Imperial College London Hub after you apply
There are only 100 slots for our hub, so make sure you sign up as soon as possible

email.heading: Ed Tech Hackday

event.text:
Join DoC on Saturday 22nd February for a one day Hackathon to help design and develop to your education tools (Materials, eMarking and more)
This is an excellent occasion for people interested in working on the Edtech platforms with us over the summer to start exploring the code and make a first contribution
Please RSVP here: https://forms.gle/foZwZKEN6XVrNVr68
Lunch will be provided on the day, so let us know if you plan to attend by selecting "Going" and filling in the form above!

email.heading: IC HealthHack 2020: Second Ticket Release

event.text:
The Department of Computing Society (DoCSoc), Bioengineering Society, ICSM Coding Society and MedTech Society proudly present the IC HealthHack 2020!
We are back with HealthHack 20 bigger and better than ever! Combining skills in bioengineering, computer science, and medicine, HealthHack will bring together talented students to tackle the most current medical challenges through technology. This year, we are focusing on Medical Education as our overarching theme. Over the weekend of 29th February - 1st March 2020, teams will bring their awesome ideas to life and develop solutions to real-life health education challenges.
Save the date and follow the event page for more details, including sponsors and schedule announcements.
Website: https://ichealthhack.org/
**Ticket release date: 13th Feb**

email.heading: Roaring Revel: First Batch Tickets Released

event.text:
This event is for 18+ only.
A little party never killed nobody, so join RCSU and DoCSoc for an extravagant night of glitz, glam and a party fit for the 20's - here's to Roaring Revel!
From Spanish rooftop bars to Parisian themed halls, we're now taking you back in time to the Prohibition era. Our chosen gin mill, Quaglino's, is decorated to the taste of the period and has a history as rich as the location of St James's.
The evening will start with a cocktail reception with further drinks served later as the night progresses. We will also be serving canapés and providing entertainment throughout the evening. So wear your ritziest garms and get ready to party like it's the 20's!
Ticket prices:
DoCSoc: £28
RCSU: £35
**First batch releases on 12th February: 1:30pm!**

email.heading: Bloomberg Industrial Placement & Graduate Positions
email.sponsor:
Bloomberg's applications for the [Industrial Placements](https://careers.bloomberg.com/job/detail/76941) and [Graduate Positions](https://careers.bloomberg.com/job/detail/76939) are open.
Bloomberg's diverse community of engineers take on some of the world’s most interesting and important technical challenges. We develop impactful solutions to complex, real-world problems. With new systems being rolled out daily, we make an immediate impact on global markets and we look for the best software engineers to build them.
